article_intro: Lists are one of the most versatile data structures in Python, allowing you to store ordered collections of items.
article_content: Python lists are mutable, ordered collections of items. They can store elements of different types and support a wide range of operations, including indexing, slicing, and iteration.

article_intro: Vectors in C++ are dynamic arrays that can grow or shrink in size, providing powerful ways to store and manipulate data.
article_content: C++ vectors are part of the STL (Standard Template Library). They provide dynamic memory allocation, efficient element access, and built-in methods for inserting and removing elements.

article_intro: Dictionaries in Python are key-value pairs that allow for fast data retrieval based on a unique key.
article_content: Python dictionaries are unordered collections of key-value pairs. They are mutable and optimized for fast data lookup.

article_intro: Arrays in C++ are fixed-size collections of elements of the same type.
article_content: C++ arrays are simple data structures for storing a fixed number of elements of the same type. They offer fast, index-based access to elements.

article_intro: Functions in Python are reusable blocks of code that perform specific tasks.
article_content: Functions are essential building blocks in Python programming, allowing code to be organized, reused, and made more readable.

article_intro: Functions in C++ allow for code reusability and better program structure.
article_content: Functions in C++ provide a way to structure programs by breaking code into reusable, named blocks.
